title: Electrician call out rate: 2026 Electrician Prices Guide for SA
markdown:
[Skip to content](https://makaraba.co.za/electrician-call-out-rate/#content "Skip to content")

# Electrician call out rate, Fees and Prices: A Complete 2026 Price Guide for South Africa

# Complete 2026 Guide to Electrician Call Out Rates and Fees in South Africa

Knowing what **Electrician call out rate** in South Africa helps homeowners and businesses. Electrician fees go from **R300 to R600** per hour. You need to plan for normal and urgent help.

For emergencies, you might pay between **R500 and R700**. Wiring a 3-bedroom home could be **R20,000 to R30,000**.

It’s key to get detailed **Electrician Quotes** to ensure good prices and quality. The average **Electrician Hourly Rate** is about **R450**. This helps estimate costs for various jobs.

Installing double plug points may cost **R400 to R600**. Getting an Electrical Certificate of Compliance (CoC) is about **R700 to R1500**.

Many things affect **Electrical Services** prices. These include job complexity, place, and the electrician’s skills. Basic repairs could be **R350 to R400** per hour.

But harder tasks might exceed **R700** per hour. For instance, ceiling fan fitting costs **R650 to R2000**. Changing light switches is generally **R650 to R1000**.

Additional materials and location matter for repair or rewiring work. Check the electrician’s qualifications and ECASA membership. Ensure quality. Always compare prices, and services, and check online reviews. It helps to find a skilled, trustworthy [electrician](https://makaraba.co.za/electricians/) – like ours.

[Contact us](https://makaraba.co.za/contact/) for the latest electrician price list 2026!

## Understanding Electrician Call Out Rates in South Africa

Looking at electrician costs in South Africa means looking into what affects these fees. The **electrician call out rate** changes for many reasons. Knowing these factors helps us plan our budgets better.

### Factors Influencing Call Out Rates

The _electrician call out rate_ depends on several things. Time of day is one, with night-time services costing more. The job’s complexity and if it’s an emergency also matter. In cities, costs are higher than in rural areas. Plus, the mix of qualified and unqualified electricians affects prices and service quality.

### Emergency Vs. Standard Call Out Fees

It’s important to know the difference between emergency and standard fees. **Emergency electrician prices** go from R500 to R700 or more for the first hour. Standard services usually cost less. But, the price depends on the task. This info helps in choosing and talking to service providers.

### Typical Prices Across Different Cities – Electrician call out rate

**Electrician Costs Per Hour** change from city to city. In Johannesburg and Cape Town, average rates are about R650 per hour. But, Durban and Pretoria might be cheaper. Look at this table to compare costs:

| City | Average Electrician Cost Per Hour | Emergency Electrician Prices | Standard Call Out Rate |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Johannesburg | R700 | R600-R800 | R500 |
| Cape Town | R680 | R600-R750 | R480 |
| Durban | R650 | R550-R700 | R450 |
| Pretoria | R670 | R570-R720 | R460 |

Understanding these price differences helps us make better choices. Always get several quotes to ensure fair **Electrician Call Out Rates**.

## Overview of Electrician Prices for Common Services – Electrician call out rate

Knowing what it costs to hire electricians can help you decide wisely. In South Africa, the price for these services changes a lot. It depends on how hard the job is, and the electrician’s experience.

### General Electrical Repair Costs

- **Hourly Rates for Basic Electrical Fixes:**
  - Standard Hourly Rate: R350 – R700
  - First Hour Rate (including setup and travel): Up to R1,050​
- **First Hour Cost:**
  - **S** tandard Rate for the First Hour: R650 – R1,050 (includes setup and travel time)​
- **Complex Jobs:**
  - Fixing a Circuit Breaker: R2,590 – R8,550
  - General Electrical Repairs: R2,590 – R8,550​ ​
- **Range for Common Electrical Jobs:**
  - Typical Range for Basic Jobs: R2,590 – R8,550
  - Factors Influencing Costs: Complexity of the job, cost of materials, location, and electrician’s experience​

### Cost of Electrical Installation

- **Simple Tasks:**
  - Installing a Light Fixture: R800 – R4,000
  - Installing a Ceiling Fan: R1,600 – R5,000
- **Complex Systems:**
  - Smart Home Technology Installation: R3,200 – R32,000
- **Generator Installation:**
  - Small Generator: R4,800 – R96,000
  - Large Generator: R96,000 – R960,000

### Electrical Maintenance Charges

Electrical maintenance prices change based on what needs doing. Regular check-ups keep things safe and working right. Costs depends on the electrician’s skill level.

It’s important to talk about prices before starting. Take into account small job minimum fees and any extra costs. This chat helps you know all the fees upfront. It helps avoid unexpected costs later.

## Home Wiring Costs for 2026 – Electrician call out rate

Knowing the cost of electrical wiring in 2026 is key for budgeting home projects. The cost depends on house size, wiring needs, and materials. Let’s look into these to make things clearer for you.

### Average Costs for Different House Sizes

The cost to wire your home changes with its size. Below are some expected costs:

| House Size (sq metres) | Average Wiring Cost |
| --- | --- |
| 75-100 | R2,800 – R7,000 |
| 125-1,50 | R4,500 – R9,000 |
| 250-4,00 | R15,000 – R46,000 |

### Wiring and Rewiring Expenses

Rewiring usually costs more than new wiring. For example, a 3-bedroom house may cost about R25,000 to wire. But, rewiring in older homes can cost R30,000 or more. These prices are part of the electrician price list for 2026. They change based on the house and work needed.

### Choosing the Right Materials and Their Impact on Price

The materials you choose affect the total cost. Better materials might be more expensive at first. But, they can save money later because they last longer and meet safety standards. Good electrical contractors provide a detailed list of costs. This helps you make informed choices.

To sum up, it’s vital to understand what influences the price of wiring your home. Knowing about the different costs helps us plan better. It keeps unexpected expenses away as we get our homes ready for 2026.

## Emergency Electrician Services: Fees and Rates – Electrician call out rate

When you face an electrical emergency, finding a quick _Emergency Electrician_ is key. Knowing the fees and rates helps you get good _best electrician prices_ without spending too much. Emergency services usually cost more because they’re urgent and risky.

### Understanding Emergency Service Charges

The fee for a 24-hour electrician includes the first hour of work. This cost can be between R600 to R1200 per hour. These charges cover the electrician being ready right away and the fast service rate for emergencies. Any more time needed is charged at normal rates, so it’s still affordable for urgent issues.

### Availability and Response Times

Having an electrician ready quickly is crucial, especially in areas with lots of power problems, like Pretoria. Here, many people look for electrician services. The first hour might cost R850, then R650 after that. This makes emergency electrical help reasonable and quick.

Remember, complex jobs might have extra costs. Having a 24-hour electrician ready offers relief. It means someone is there to fix sudden electrical issues quickly, stopping more problems or dangers.

## Comparing Residential and Commercial Electrician Rates

The cost of hiring an electrician changes a lot between home and business services. It’s key to know this difference for planning your budget. This is true whether you’re fixing a problem or just doing regular checks.

### Differences in Pricing Structures

A home electrician and a business electrician have different prices. This is because their work varies in complexity and size. In South Africa, electricians charge from R350 to R1200 an hour. Home tasks like wiring and repairs are simpler and quicker. So, they cost less. Business services cost more because they need more skills for things like data wires and fixing big machines.

### Service Requirements and Their Impact on Costs – Electrician call out rate

What work is needed greatly affects the price. Home jobs often involve checks costing R300 to R750. They’re done fast. Business tasks need more knowledge because they involve more power and complicated systems. This means paying R500 to R1200 per hour for a business electrician. The cost for newcomers is R150 to R300 an hour. Also, materials like electrical wires add to the cost. They are R15 to R30 per meter.

To sum up, when thinking of getting an electrician for a home or business, consider the prices and work needed. This way, you can plan your money better and find good electrician services.

## FAQ

### 1\. What are the common factors influencing electrician call out rates in South Africa?

Several things affect electrician call out rates in South Africa. These include the time of day and job complexity. Also, emergency services cost more than standard ones. Rates are higher in cities due to the cost of labour.

### 2\. How much do emergency electrician services typically cost?

**Emergency electrician** services cost more. You might pay between R500 to R700 for a call out. This usually includes the first hour of work. Work after that is extra.

### 3\. What is the average hourly rate for a standard electrical service in South Africa?

The hourly rate for a standard electrical service varies. It can be between R300 to R600. On average, it’s about R450 per hour for work, not counting parts or supplies.

### 4\. How much does it cost to wire a standard 3-bedroom house?

Wiring a standard 3-bedroom house can cost R20,000 to R30,000. The average is R25,000. This depends on the house size and what electrical work is needed.

### 5\. What are the usual costs associated with electrical repairs?

Electrical repairs usually charge by the hour, costing R350 to R700. The total cost hinges on the repair’s complexity and any extra parts needed.

### 6\. What is the price range for data cabling installation?

Data cabling installation fees range from R550 to R850 for each point. Costs vary based on the project details and materials used.

### 7\. How much does an electrical certificate of compliance (CoC) cost?

An electrical certificate of compliance (CoC) costs R700 to R1500. This depends on the property’s type and size.

### 8\. Are the rates for residential and commercial electrical services different?

Yes, costs differ for residential and commercial **electrical services**. Residential focuses on simple fixes, wiring, and checks. But commercial tasks are more complex, like data cabling and major electrical work. This makes them more pricey.

### 9\. How can I find affordable electricians near me?

To find budget-friendly electricians, compare several quotes. Look at online feedback and ask people you trust. Picking a skilled, licensed electrician also ensures good, affordable service.

### 10\. What is the price for replacing an electrical outlet?

Replacing an electrical outlet usually costs R300 to R500. This varies with the job’s specifics and if extra work like rewiring is needed.

How do we know these prices?
Thousands of people ask Procompare for help with their projects every year. We track the quotes they get from our local Pros and share those prices with you.

### Electrician — rate per hour

- **R400 – R800/hour**

This is the electrician's average hourly rate for labour. The rate will vary according to day and time (i.e. if work is done out of hours) and does not include price of any electrical supplies or replacement parts. Also an emergency call-out fee may apply.
The average cost to hire an electrician's rate per hour is **R600/hour**, or typically between **R400/hour** and **R800/hour**.


[Get quotes](https://www.procompare.co.za/electricians)

### Home wiring — 3-bedroom house

- **R25,000 – R38,000**

This is the price for wiring a 3-bedroom house. The total cost will depend on the exact size of the house, the number of light/plug points installed, the fittings, fixtures and accessories used.
Wiring a 3-bedroom house costs range between **R25,000** and **R38,000** with an average of **R31,000**.


[Get quotes](https://www.procompare.co.za/electricians)

### Data cabling — price per point

- **R700 – R1100**

This is the average price per data point. The final cost of data cabling varies depending on the number of data points, scope of work, site (business or residential installation), and location.
The average cost of data cabling is **R900**, or typically between **R700** and **R1100**.


[Get quotes](https://www.procompare.co.za/electricians)

### Electrician — emergency call out fee

- **R600 – R900**

This is the electrician's call out fee and it's separate from any labour charges. The price depends on your issue and the day and time. Sometimes it includes the first hours' worth of labour.
On average, expect to be charged between **R600** and **R900** for an electrician's emergency call out fee.


[Get quotes](https://www.procompare.co.za/electricians)

### Price per double plug point

- **R500 – R800**

This is the price for a double plug point when installing new wiring or rewiring. The final price depends on the number of points/double points installed, materials used, site (business or residential), and location.
On average, expect to be charged between **R500** and **R800** for a double plug point.


[Get quotes](https://www.procompare.co.za/electricians)

### Price per point

- **R400 – R600**

This is the price per light or plug point when installing new wiring or rewiring. The final price depends on the number of points installed, materials used, site (business or residential), and location.
For plug or light point, expect to pay between **R400** and **R600**.


[Get quotes](https://www.procompare.co.za/electricians)

### Electrical CoC

- **R900 – R1900**

This is the price of an electrical certificate of compliance (Electrical CoC) of an average house. The price varies depending on the location, condition, size of the installation, and type of property..
Electrical CoC costs range between **R900** and **R1900** with an average of **R1400**.

title: Electrician Prices 2026: Guide to Electrician Call Out Rate in SA
markdown:
[Skip to content](https://thirtyone.co.za/electrician-prices/#content "Skip to content")

# Electrician Prices 2026: Detailed Guide to Electrician Call Out Rate and Electrical Services in South Africa

## Electrician Prices 2026: Detailed Look at Electrician Call Out Rate and Electrical Services Fees

This guide will help you understand **Electrician prices** in South Africa for 2026. It’s essential for homeowners and business owners to grasp **electrician rates** for budgeting purposes.

In South Africa, **electrician prices** range from R350 to R700 per hour. The average rate is about R550 per hour. Residential electrical repairs can cost between R650 and R5000+.

Electrical repair costs vary based on project type, qualifications, and experience. Simple tasks might cost R350-R400 per hour. Complex jobs could range from R450-R700 per hour.

Master electricians can charge R500-R900+ per hour for specialised work. Call-out fees typically range from R650 to R950. These fees often cover the first hour of work.

Subsequent hours are billed at the electrician’s standard rate. Emergency services or after-hours work come with premium rates. Let’s explore costs for common **electrical services** in 2026.

[Contact us](https://thirtyone.co.za/contact/) for the **electricians price list** 2026 or [Book a Electrican](https://thirtyone.co.za/electricians/)

## Electrician Prices: Understanding Electrician Rates in South Africa

Hiring an electrician in South Africa can be confusing. This guide will help you grasp the costs for your home or business needs.

### Average Hourly Rates for Electricians

**Electrician rates** in South Africa vary based on several factors. You can expect to pay between R450 and R950 per hour.

Basic tasks start at around R500 per hour. More complex jobs can cost up to R1300 per hour.

| Service Level | Hourly Rate Range |
| --- | --- |
| Basic Tasks | R450 – R600 |
| Standard Services | R600 – R900 |
| Specialised Work | R900 – R1300 |

### Factors Affecting Electrician Pricing

Job complexity, experience, location, and time of day influence electrical service costs. Materials required also play a role in pricing.

Wiring a new room could cost around R8,000. This includes labour, materials, and additional fees.

### Call-out Fees and Emergency Rates

Electricians typically charge call-out fees from R500 to R1200. Emergency rates are higher, averaging R900 per hour.

Regular business hours often have competitive call-out fees. Expect to pay more for after-hours or weekend services.

Quality and safety should be your top priorities when dealing with electrical work. Always hire a qualified professional for your electrical needs.

## Residential Electrical Services Costs – Electrician Prices

Knowing residential electrical service costs is vital for South African homeowners. We’ll examine common repairs, wiring expenses, and installation prices for various electrical components.

### Common household electrical repairs

Residential electricians tackle a variety of household repairs. Ceiling fan installation costs between R650 and R2000. Light switch replacement ranges from R650 to R1000.

Fixing a breaker switch is more complex and can cost R500 to R1000.

### Wiring and rewiring costs for homes

New home electrical wiring costs vary based on size and complexity. On average, wiring a new house can cost R65,000 to R250,000.

Rewiring an existing home is usually cheaper, ranging from R10,000 to R35,000.

### Installation prices for lighting and outlets – Electrician Prices

**Lighting installation** prices depend on fixture type and wiring needs. A **residential electrician** might charge R600 to R6,500 for light installations.

New plug point installation costs R300-R500 per point. Double plug points are slightly pricier at R400-R600.

| Service | Price Range |
| --- | --- |
| Ceiling Fan Installation | R650 – R2000 |
| Light Switch Replacement | R650 – R1000 |
| New House Wiring | R65,000 – R250,000 |
| House Rewiring | R10,000 – R35,000 |
| Light Installation | R600 – R6,500 |
| Single Plug Point Installation | R300 – R500 |
| Double Plug Point Installation | R400 – R600 |

Keep in mind, these are estimated prices. Your final **electrical installation cost** may differ. Factors like location, job complexity, and specific home requirements can affect the price.

## Commercial Electrical Work Pricing – Electrician Prices

Commercial electrical work in South Africa involves complex installations and high-grade materials. Our pricing guide reflects the scale of these projects. **Commercial electrician** rates typically range from R450 to R900+ per hour.

**Electrical contractor rates** vary based on project scope and location. In Midrand, where demand is highest, prices may be higher. Commercial properties often require **electrical services**, with an average of 15 electrical points per job.

**Electrical maintenance** contracts for businesses depend on property size and service frequency. For a 12-room commercial property, annual maintenance costs can range from R15,000 to R50,000.

| Service | Average Cost |
| --- | --- |
| Inverter with Battery Backup | R25,000 – R75,000 |
| Lithium-ion Battery Bank | R50,000 – R150,000 |
| Solar Power Installation | R80,000 – R250,000 |
| Electrical Panel Upgrade | R15,000 – R35,000 |

**Electrical service fees** often include a call-out charge of R500 to R1,500 for commercial properties. Urgent requests, about 20% of all jobs, may cost extra. Flat-rate pricing is gaining popularity among commercial electricians.

## Electrician Prices for Specialised Services

South Africa’s demand for advanced electrical solutions is growing rapidly. Requests for solar panels, **electric vehicle charging** stations, and smart home upgrades are increasing. Let’s look at the costs of these modern services.

### Solar Panel Installation Costs

**Solar panel installation** prices vary based on system size and complexity. In South Africa, a residential solar setup costs between R50,000 and R150,000. The cost per watt ranges from R15 to R25, depending on panel and inverter quality.

### Electric Vehicle Charging Station Installation

**Electric vehicle charging** station installations now have high demand. This service can cost between R5,000 and R20,000, depending on charger type and existing electrical setup. Some areas may require permits, which could increase the overall expense.

### Smart Home Electrical Upgrades – Electrician Prices

Smart home **electrical upgrades** are becoming popular across South Africa. Prices range from R200 for a simple smart switch to R20,000 for a full home automation system. These services often require electricians with special certifications, affecting pricing.

Specialised electrician services in South Africa cost around R1,100 per hour on average. Additional labour is billed at R375 per 30 minutes.

## FAQ

### 1\. What are typical hourly rates for electricians in South Africa?

Electricians in South Africa charge between R350 to R700+ per hour. Simple jobs cost R350-R400 hourly. Complex jobs range from R450-R700 per hour.

### 2\. How much do common household electrical repairs cost?

Ceiling fan installation costs R650 to R2000. Light switch replacement ranges from R650 to R1000. New plug point installation is R300-R500 per point.

Double plug points cost R400-R600. **Lighting installation** prices vary based on fixture type and wiring needs.

### 3\. What is the average cost for rewiring a home in South Africa?

Home rewiring in South Africa averages R30,000. Costs range from R20,000 to R150,000 for labour and materials.

### 4\. What factors affect electrician pricing?

Job type, location, expertise, and project complexity influence electrician pricing. Call-out fees typically range from R650 to R950. Emergency rates may be higher, up to R900+ per hour.

### 5\. How much do electricians charge for commercial electrical work?

Commercial electricians may charge R450 to R900+ per hour. Costs depend on project scope and complexity. Maintenance contracts vary based on premises size and service frequency.

### 6\. What are the costs for specialised electrical services?

Specialised services often cost more. **Solar panel installation** prices vary by system size. **Electric vehicle charging** station costs depend on charger type.

Smart home upgrades range from simple switch installations to full automation systems. These services may require additional certifications, affecting pricing.

# Electrical Price Comparison and Average Costs for Every Home and Business in Pretoria, East, North, Centurion, Midrand, Johannesburg, Sandton & Gauteng

## Electrical Price Comparison and Average Costs Explained in Pretoria, East, North, Centurion, Midrand, Johannesburg, Sandton & Gauteng

Have you ever wondered why electrician quotes vary so dramatically across different suburbs? Our **Electrical Price Comparison and Average Costs** guide helps you understand pricing differences and ensures you get fair value for quality workmanship. We know how frustrating it can be to budget for home improvements or urgent repairs when costs seem inconsistent.

Finding reliable services at transparent rates shouldn’t feel like solving a puzzle. That’s exactly why we at **Handyman Pretoria** have created this comprehensive guide. Our mission is to empower you with _honest, straightforward information_ about what you should expect to pay in 2026.

![Electrical Price Comparison and Average Costs](https://handymanpretoria.co.za/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/Electrical-Price-Comparison-and-Average-Costs-1024x585.jpeg)

This guide reveals current electrician hourly rates ranging from R350 to R700. Most professionals charge around R550 per hour. We’ll break down call-out fees and **compare electrician prices** for common jobs.

You’ll also discover how to identify **affordable electrical installation** options without compromising on safety or quality. Whether you’re planning a renovation or facing an emergency, we’re here to help. Make informed decisions about your electrical needs with confidence – [Contact Us](https://handymanpretoria.co.za/contact/)

## Understanding Electrical Service Pricing Across the Region – Electrical Price Comparison and Average Costs

Complete transparency guides our pricing structure at Handyman Pretoria. Knowing how electrical services are priced helps you budget effectively and avoid surprises. Our approach to **electrical contractor average pricing** is straightforward and fair.

We consider the complexity of work, required qualifications, and your location’s specific needs. From Pretoria to Centurion, Midrand, or Johannesburg, we provide clear information. This helps you make informed decisions about your electrical projects.

Understanding the _home electrical pricing guide_ starts with knowing what influences final costs. Job complexity, time of day, and location determine professional electrical service pricing. We’ve designed our pricing to reflect real-world conditions whilst maintaining competitive regional rates.

![A detailed comparison of residential electrical costs across the Gauteng region, showcasing the varying prices and trends. In the foreground, a trio of modern houses representing different neighborhoods - Pretoria, Centurion, and Johannesburg. Overlaid are transparent price charts and graphs, detailing the average monthly electrical bills, installation fees, and service rates for each location. The background features a stylized cityscape, with skyscrapers and infrastructure reflecting the urban setting. The lighting is soft and warm, creating an informative yet visually appealing scene. The overall composition conveys a sense of data-driven analysis and regional differences in electrical service pricing.](https://handymanpretoria.co.za/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/A-detailed-comparison-of-residential-electrical-costs-across-the-Gauteng-region-showcasing-the-1024x585.jpeg)

### How We Structure Our Electrical Services at Handyman Pretoria

Our service structure gives you flexibility and value for any electrical work needed. We offer several pricing models to accommodate different project types. Customer preferences guide our approach to electrical service delivery.

At Handyman Pretoria, we structure services around three main pricing categories:

- **Basic electrical tasks** starting at approximately R500 per hour, covering simple repairs like replacing switches or installing new light fixtures
- **Standard electrical services** ranging from R600 to R900 per hour, including circuit installations, distribution board upgrades, and _cost of new electrical outlets_
- **Specialised electrical work** costing between R900 and R1,300 per hour, encompassing complex installations, three-phase systems, and commercial-grade electrical solutions

This tiered approach ensures you pay only for the expertise your project requires. We conduct a thorough **local electrician cost consultation** before starting any work. You’ll always know exactly what to expect from the beginning.

Our _electrical service package pricing_ includes materials and consumables for most standard jobs. This means fewer surprise costs and more accurate final bills. Your initial quote matches what you actually pay.

> “Transparency in pricing builds trust, and trust is the foundation of every successful electrical project.”

#### Regional Service Call-Out Fees

Regional service call-out fees reflect travel distance and local market conditions. Our call-out fees typically cover the first hour of work. Diagnostic assessment provides immediate value from the moment we arrive.

We proudly serve customers within a 40-kilometre radius without additional travel charges. Locations beyond this range may incur supplementary fees. Emergency after-hours service accounts for travel time and premium availability.

| Location | Standard Call-Out Fee | Emergency Call-Out Fee | Service Hours |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Pretoria Central | R650 – R800 | R950 – R1,200 | Mon-Fri: 7am-5pm |
| Centurion | R700 – R850 | R900 – R1,150 | Mon-Fri: 7am-5pm |
| Midrand | R750 – R900 | R950 – R1,200 | Mon-Fri: 7am-5pm |
| Johannesburg North | R800 – R950 | R1,000 – R1,300 | Mon-Fri: 7am-5pm |

These **average electrical wiring prices by region** reflect current market conditions and competitive rates. Regular business hours offer more competitive call-out fees. Weekend or after-hours emergency services cost more.

Emergency electrical work averages around R900 per hour. Call-out fees range from R950 to R1,200 depending on location and urgency. We’re available 24/7 for genuine electrical emergencies that pose safety risks.

### Residential vs Commercial Electrical Pricing

Understanding the difference between **residential electrical cost comparison** and commercial pricing is essential. These two sectors have distinctly different requirements and cost structures. The scale, complexity, and regulatory standards vary significantly.

Residential electrical work typically involves smaller-scale projects in family homes. These include installing plug points, replacing light switches, and rewiring rooms. The _average electrical repair costs_ for homes tend to be more predictable.

Commercial electrical pricing reflects larger scale operations and higher complexity. Business properties need higher-grade materials and extensive safety measures. Work often happens outside business hours to avoid disruption.

Here’s a detailed **commercial electrical cost comparison** showing how residential and commercial projects differ:

| Service Type | Residential Pricing | Commercial Pricing | Key Differences |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Hourly Labour Rate | R500 – R900 | R600 – R1,100 | Commercial requires certified commercial electricians |
| Plug Point Installation | R350 – R600 each | R500 – R900 each | Commercial uses industrial-grade materials |
| Distribution Board Upgrade | R3,500 – R8,000 | R8,000 – R25,000 | Commercial boards handle higher capacity loads |
| Complete Rewiring | R25,000 – R60,000 | R80,000 – R250,000+ | Commercial includes three-phase systems and backup power |
| Maintenance Contracts | Not typically offered | R1,500 – R5,000/month | Regular inspections and preventative maintenance |

The **electrical fitting charges** and _appliance wiring cost estimates_ differ based on property type. Commercial installations demand compliance with stricter safety codes. Certificates of compliance must meet municipal and insurance standards.

Residential clients can **compare residential electrician prices** through our competitive rates. Our _home electrical system upgrade costs_ are transparent. Detailed quotes are provided before any work commences.

Commercial clients benefit from our comprehensive _electrical service package pricing_ with regular maintenance contracts. These contracts vary based on property size and service frequency. Small to medium-sized businesses typically pay R1,500 to R5,000 per month.

We understand that **electrical troubleshooting charges** and _electrical service repair charges_ need justification. We always explain what work needs doing and why. This gives you information to make cost-effective decisions.

Searching for the **lowest electrician service charges** or trying to _find local electrical cost comparison_ data? We encourage you to **get quotes for electrical price comparison** from multiple providers. We’re confident our combination of competitive pricing, professional expertise, and excellent customer service makes sense.

Our commitment to providing detailed _electrical wiring cost comparison_ information means accurate budgeting from the start. No hidden fees, no surprise charges exist. Just honest, professional electrical services at fair prices reflecting quality and safety.

## Electrical Price Comparison and Average Costs

Getting accurate cost estimates for electrical work shouldn’t feel like guesswork. We’ve compiled comprehensive pricing data for homeowners and businesses across Gauteng. Understanding the **average cost of electrical wiring** and services helps you budget effectively and avoid surprises.

At Handyman Pretoria, we believe in complete transparency regarding pricing. Our goal is to provide realistic expectations based on current market rates. We cover Pretoria, Centurion, Midrand, and Johannesburg.

The electrical services market in 2026 reflects both quality craftsmanship and fair pricing. We’ve structured this comprehensive guide to give you _real numbers_ you can rely on. Use these figures when planning your next project.

### Average Electrician Hourly Rates Across Gauteng

Understanding **affordable electrician hourly rates** starts with recognising different skill levels. Different types of work require different qualifications. At Handyman Pretoria, our pricing structure reflects industry standards whilst ensuring exceptional value.

Basic electrical tasks like replacing light switches cost between R450 and R600 per hour. Installing standard plug points falls into this category. These straightforward jobs don’t require extensive planning or specialised equipment.

Standard electrical services involve more complex work. This includes upgrading distribution boards and installing ceiling fans. Troubleshooting electrical faults also fits here.

For these services, expect rates ranging from R600 to R900 per hour.

Specialised electrical work demands master electrician qualifications and extensive experience. Complex commercial installations fall into this category. Solar system integration and industrial electrical systems require this expertise.

The **certified electrician average price** for such work ranges from R900 to R1,300 per hour.

| Service Category | Hourly Rate Range | Typical Tasks Included | Qualification Level |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Basic Electrical Tasks | R450 – R600 | Light switch replacement, simple plug installation, basic fault finding | Qualified Electrician |
| Standard Electrical Services | R600 – R900 | Distribution board upgrades, ceiling fan installation, circuit additions | Experienced Electrician |
| Specialised Electrical Work | R900 – R1,300 | Solar integration, commercial installations, industrial systems, compliance audits | Master Electrician |
| Emergency Call-Out Services | R750 – R1,500 | After-hours repairs, urgent fault resolution, safety hazard response | Qualified Electrician (Premium Rates) |

Remember that the lowest quote isn’t always the best value. Quality workmanship matters significantly. Proper certification and adherence to safety standards should weigh heavily in your decision.

> The bitterness of poor quality remains long after the sweetness of low price is forgotten.

Benjamin Franklin

![A detailed, data-driven infographic showing the comparative costs of electrical work per square foot across Pretoria, Centurion, Midrand, and Johannesburg. The foreground features a clean, modern layout with clear data visualizations and icons, while the middle ground showcases various electrical installations and projects. The background depicts the cityscape of the targeted region, with skyscrapers and landmarks providing contextual cues. The overall mood is informative and authoritative, with a neutral color palette and sleek, minimalist design elements to convey the technical nature of the subject matter.](https://handymanpretoria.co.za/wp-content/uploads/2025/11/A-detailed-data-driven-infographic-showing-the-comparative-costs-of-electrical-work-per-square-1024x585.jpeg)

### Common Electrical Installation Costs

Installation projects form the bulk of electrical work we handle at Handyman Pretoria. From simple socket additions to complete property wiring, understanding these costs helps you plan accurately. We’ve categorised installation work into two main groups: basic electrical fittings and major installation projects.

#### Basic Electrical Fittings and Outlets

Basic electrical fittings represent the most frequent requests we receive from homeowners and small businesses. These installations are typically completed within a few hours. They provide immediate functional improvements to your property.

Single plug point installation costs between R300 and R500. The price depends on the location and whether additional wiring is needed. Double plug points range from R400 to R600.

Light switch replacement typically runs between R650 and R1,000. The **electrical socket installation charges** vary based on the switch type. Standard, dimmer, or smart switches each have different price points.

Kitchen and bathroom electrical work requires additional considerations due to moisture and safety regulations. The **kitchen electrical installation cost** for basic fittings includes specialised outlets. Proper earthing systems are also necessary.

| Installation Type | Price Range | Time Required | Materials Included |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Single Plug Point | R300 – R500 | 30 – 60 minutes | Standard socket, faceplate, basic wiring |
| Double Plug Point | R400 – R600 | 45 – 90 minutes | Double socket, faceplate, wiring, back box |
| Light Switch Replacement | R650 – R1,000 | 30 – 75 minutes | Switch mechanism, faceplate, testing |
| Ceiling Fan Installation | R650 – R2,000 | 60 – 150 minutes | Mounting bracket, wiring, switch (fan not included) |
| Bathroom Electrical Fitting | R800 – R1,500 | 90 – 180 minutes | IP-rated fittings, earth leakage protection, sealed connections |

These prices include labour and standard materials. Speciality outlets will increase costs accordingly. Smart home integration or locations requiring extensive additional wiring also raise prices.

#### Major Electrical Installation Projects

Major installation projects require careful planning, extensive labour, and significant material investment. These projects transform properties or ensure complete electrical safety and functionality.

Complete house wiring for new builds represents one of the largest electrical investments you’ll make. The **new build electrical work cost** ranges from R65,000 to R250,000. This depends on property size, specification level, and the number of circuits required.

Rewiring existing homes costs less than new installations but still represents a substantial investment. The **rewiring old house average costs** average around R30,000. Typical ranges fall between R20,000 and R45,000.

This comprehensive **home rewiring price guide** figure includes labour, materials, and compliance certification.

Wiring a single new room costs approximately R8,000. This includes all necessary circuits, outlets, and lighting points. Connection to the main distribution board is also included.

Electrical panel upgrades have become increasingly necessary as homes add more appliances and smart devices. These upgrades cost between R15,000 and R35,000. The price depends on the panel capacity and complexity of the installation.

| Major Project Type | Average Cost | Cost Per Square Metre | Duration |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| New House Wiring (150m²) | R65,000 – R150,000 | R433 – R1,000 | 5 – 10 days |
| House Rewiring (100m²) | R20,000 – R45,000 | R200 – R450 | 3 – 7 days |
| Single Room Wiring | R6,000 – R10,000 | R400 – R667 | 1 – 2 days |
| Electrical Panel Upgrade | R15,000 – R35,000 | N/A | 1 – 2 days |
| Solar Power Installation | R80,000 – R250,000 | N/A | 3 – 7 days |

External electrical work follows different pricing structures. Above-ground electrical lines cost R200 or more per metre. Underground lines range from R200 to R500+ per metre due to excavation requirements.

Energy efficiency upgrades have gained popularity with load shedding concerns. Inverter systems with battery backup cost between R25,000 and R75,000. Lithium-ion battery banks range from R50,000 to R150,000, depending on capacity requirements.

The **whole house electrical cost estimate** for a comprehensive renovation typically ranges from R50,000 to R150,000. This includes rewiring, panel upgrade, and energy efficiency installations for an average-sized home.

### Electrical Repair and Maintenance Pricing Guide

Regular maintenance and timely repairs prevent costly emergencies. They ensure your electrical systems remain safe and efficient. At Handyman Pretoria, we offer transparent pricing for all repair and maintenance services.

Understanding **yearly electrical maintenance costs** helps you budget for ongoing property care. Preventative maintenance typically costs far less than emergency repairs. It also extends the lifespan of your electrical infrastructure.

#### Standard Electrical Repairs

Standard repairs address the common issues that arise in residential and commercial properties. These services restore functionality quickly and safely. They prevent minor problems from becoming major hazards.

Breaker switch repairs cost between R500 and R1,000. The price depends on whether the breaker needs repair or complete replacement. The **fuse box replacement service cost** includes testing all circuits and ensuring proper earth leakage protection.

Light installation varies dramatically based on fixture complexity. Basic installations start at R600. Complex chandelier or outdoor lighting installations can reach R6,500.

The **ceiling light installation cost average** for standard residential fixtures sits around R1,200 to R2,000.

Distribution board troubleshooting requires diagnostic expertise to identify faults accurately. We charge based on the time required for diagnosis plus the specific repairs needed. Simple issues may be resolved within an hour, whilst complex faults requiring circuit tracing take considerably longer.

| Repair Service | Price Range | Common Causes | Prevention Tips |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Breaker Switch Repair | R500 – R1,000 | Overloading, age, moisture damage | Don’t overload circuits, annual inspections |
| Light Installation | R600 – R6,500 | New fittings, upgrades, replacements | Use correct wattage bulbs, proper fixtures |
| Electrical Outlet Repair | R400 – R800 | Loose connections, physical damage, burning | Avoid overloading, replace damaged outlets immediately |
| Distribution Board Troubleshooting | R600 – R1,500 | Tripping breakers, power fluctuations, fault indication | Professional annual inspections, immediate fault reporting |

The **electrical fault repair average charges** depend heavily on diagnosis time and parts required. We always provide a detailed quote after assessing the issue. This ensures no unexpected costs.

Emergency repairs command premium rates due to after-hours availability and immediate response requirements. The **emergency electrical repair charges** typically start at R750. They can reach R1,500 per hour for urgent safety hazards requiring immediate attention.

#### Electrical Inspection and Safety Services

Safety inspections and compliance certificates protect your property investment and ensure legal compliance. These services identify potential hazards before they cause damage or injury.

Certificates of Compliance (CoC) are legally required when selling property in South Africa. The **electrical safety inspection fees** for a standard residential property range from R1,200 to R2,500. This depends on property size and complexity.

Comprehensive electrical safety inspections include checking earth leakage systems and testing all distribution boards. They verify proper earthing throughout the property. They also ensure all installations meet current SANS 10142 regulations.

These inspections typically cost between R800 and R1,800 for residential properties.

Annual maintenance contracts provide excellent value for property owners who want ongoing peace of mind. These contracts include scheduled inspections and priority service. They also offer discounted repair rates.

We structure our maintenance agreements based on property size and electrical system complexity.

| Inspection Service | Residential Cost | Commercial Cost | What’s Included |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Certificate of Compliance | R1,200 – R2,500 | R2,500 – R8,000 | Full inspection, testing, certification, minor adjustments |
| Electrical Safety Inspection | R800 – R1,800 | R1,800 – R5,000 | Earth leakage testing, board inspection, earthing verification |
| Annual Maintenance Contract | R2,400 – R6,000 | R6,000 – R25,000 | Quarterly inspections, priority repairs, discounted rates |
| Load Calculation Service | R1,500 – R3,500 | R3,500 – R12,000 | Current load assessment, capacity recommendations, upgrade planning |

Load calculation services have become _increasingly important_ with the rise of electric vehicles and solar installations. High-power appliances also contribute to this need. These assessments ensure your electrical system can handle current and future demands safely.

Preventative maintenance consistently proves more cost-effective than reactive repairs. Annual inspections typically cost R800 to R1,500. Emergency repairs for preventable issues often exceed R2,000 plus the cost of damaged equipment.

We offer **seasonal electrician discounts** during quieter periods. This makes it more affordable to schedule non-urgent maintenance and upgrades. Contact Handyman Pretoria to discuss current promotional offers and how we can help you maintain safe, efficient electrical systems.

## Factors Affecting Electrical Costs in Different Areas – Electrical Price Comparison and Average Costs

The cost of electrical work can differ significantly depending on where you live. At Handyman Pretoria, we believe in complete transparency about what influences pricing. Understanding these factors helps you budget accurately and ensures no surprises.

Multiple elements come together to determine the final price you’ll pay for electrical services. From geographical location to project complexity, each factor plays a role. These elements shape the **fair price for electrical installation** you can expect in your area.

### Regional Pricing Variations Across Gauteng

Prices for electrical work aren’t identical across Pretoria, Centurion, Midrand, and Johannesburg. Several key factors create these regional differences. We want you to understand exactly why.

Property values and the cost of living vary considerably between these four areas. Centurion and certain parts of Johannesburg generally command higher service rates. The _residential electrician visit cost_ in these premium areas reflects the overall economic environment.

Midrand occupies a strategic position between Pretoria and Johannesburg. This location often creates competitive pricing as service providers from both cities operate there. You’ll frequently find that the **local price guide average electrician costs** in Midrand fall between the rates.

![A detailed, technical price guide for electrical services in different regions, presented on a sleek, modern dashboard. In the foreground, a series of interactive graphs and charts showcase the average costs for common household electrical work, such as wiring, installation, and maintenance, across neighborhoods in Pretoria, Centurion, Midrand, and Johannesburg. The middle ground features a color-coded map of the region, highlighting the variance in pricing. The background depicts a cityscape with skyscrapers and infrastructure, conveying the urban setting. The lighting is clean and directional, casting subtle shadows to add depth. The overall tone is informative and data-driven, with a professional, authoritative atmosphere.](data:image/svg+xml,%3Csvg%20xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'%20viewBox='0%200%20700%20400'%3E%3C/svg%3E)

Local demand significantly influences pricing structures too. Areas experiencing construction booms may see different pricing. Neighbourhoods with older housing stock requiring more electrical upgrades also affect costs.

Travel distance affects costs as well. Most reputable electricians don’t charge extra within a 40-kilometre radius of their base. Beyond that radius, you might encounter additional travel fees.

Security requirements and access challenges in different neighbourhoods can also influence pricing. This particularly affects **commercial building wiring cost** in high-security business parks. Gated residential estates may also see pricing variations.

| Service Type | Pretoria | Centurion | Midrand | Johannesburg |
| --- | --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Ceiling Fan Installation | R850 – R1,200 | R900 – R1,350 | R875 – R1,250 | R950 – R1,400 |
| Electrical Inspection | R1,200 – R1,800 | R1,350 – R2,000 | R1,250 – R1,900 | R1,400 – R2,100 |
| Distribution Board Upgrade | R3,500 – R6,500 | R3,800 – R7,000 | R3,650 – R6,750 | R4,000 – R7,500 |
| Kitchen Rewiring (Standard) | R4,500 – R8,000 | R4,800 – R8,500 | R4,650 – R8,200 | R5,000 – R9,000 |

This comparison shows typical pricing variations for common services across our four service regions. These ranges provide a realistic _affordable rewiring price comparison_. They help you understand what’s reasonable for your specific location.

### How Project Complexity and Materials Impact Your Investment

Project scope and material costs are perhaps the most significant factors affecting your final electrical bill. The complexity of the job directly impacts labour time. It also affects the expertise required.

A simple plug point installation in an easily accessible location is straightforward and inexpensive. Installing the same plug point in a difficult-to-access area will cost considerably more. The **cost of rewiring a house** varies dramatically based on accessibility and existing infrastructure.

> “Quality and safety should be your top priorities when dealing with electrical work. Cutting corners on materials or choosing unqualified electricians to save money can lead to dangerous situations and costly repairs down the line.”

Material costs vary based on quality, brand, and specifications. We always recommend using SANS-approved materials and reputable brands. These ensure safety and longevity, even if they cost slightly more upfront.

Copper wiring, circuit breakers, distribution boards, conduits, and electrical fittings all come in various quality grades. Understanding the _lighting installation cost guide_ and _switchboard replacement cost_ requires looking at both components. We’ll help you understand the cost-benefit ratio of different options.

| Material Component | Economy Grade | Standard Grade | Premium Grade |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| 2.5mm² Copper Cable (per metre) | R18 – R22 | R24 – R28 | R30 – R35 |
| 20A Circuit Breaker | R45 – R65 | R75 – R95 | R110 – R145 |
| 12-Way Distribution Board | R850 – R1,100 | R1,200 – R1,600 | R1,800 – R2,400 |
| LED Downlight Fitting | R120 – R180 | R200 – R300 | R350 – R500 |

For larger projects, the scope expands to include planning, compliance documentation, and inspections. Potential municipal approvals may also be required. All of these add to the overall cost but are essential for legal and safe installations.

The **electrical code compliance costs** ensure your installation meets all regulatory requirements. Electricians who are members of ECASA have proper qualifications. They charge more than those without necessary credentials.

This investment in qualified professionals protects you from substandard work. It also prevents potential safety hazards. The _electrical inspection cost average_ reflects the thoroughness required for proper certification.

Calculating **electrical work cost per square foot** for new installations requires careful consideration. Complexity matters more than size alone. A 50-square-metre area with intricate lighting designs will cost more per square foot than a basic space.

### The Handyman Pretoria Advantage

We offer a compelling combination of competitive pricing, qualified expertise, and genuine commitment to customer satisfaction. Our services cover all four areas. Comparing the _electrical panel replacement cost_ or seeking the best **kitchen electrical installation cost** becomes easier with us.

Our electricians are fully qualified and, where applicable, members of ECASA. This ensures you receive professional service that meets all regulatory requirements. We don’t just meet standards – we exceed them.

We provide transparent, detailed quotes that break down labour and material costs. There are no surprises once the work is complete. Whether you need **bathroom electrical work charges** explained or want to understand _home electrical upgrade costs_, we provide clarity.

Our pricing remains competitive without compromising on quality or safety. We believe you shouldn’t have to choose between affordability and excellence. The **average cost electrical breaker box** installation or _cost of installing ceiling fans_ represents genuine value.

We maintain comprehensive insurance coverage, protecting both our team and your property during all electrical work. Customer testimonials from across our four service areas consistently highlight our reliability. They also praise our professionalism and fair pricing.

We offer the convenience of serving the entire region. You’ll receive the same high-quality service regardless of location. Our **electrical system installation estimate** process is thorough yet efficient, respecting your time and budget.

We also provide flexible scheduling, including after-hours emergency services. We stand behind our work with solid guarantees. These give you peace of mind long after the project is complete.

Choosing Handyman Pretoria means choosing a local company that understands the specific electrical challenges across the region. We’re committed to delivering value that goes beyond just competitive pricing. We deliver expertise, reliability, and service excellence on every single project.

## Electrical Price Comparison and Average Costs: Conclusion

This guide covers **electrical price comparison** and average costs across Pretoria, Centurion, Midrand, and Johannesburg. Understanding service costs helps you budget effectively and avoid unexpected expenses.

We recommend getting quotes from at least three different professionals before hiring anyone. This approach lets you **compare electrician prices** whilst evaluating qualifications and experience. The lowest quote doesn’t always represent the best value for your money.

A **certified electrician average price** reflects quality workmanship, proper insurance, and safety compliance. Ask about qualifications, materials, and what’s included in the price when requesting estimates. Reputable **electrical service provider cost estimates** should be transparent and detailed every time.

Check online reviews and ask for recommendations to ensure you’re working with trusted professionals. Safety should never be compromised to save money on any project. Electrical work requires expertise, so always hire qualified professionals for your needs.

At Handyman Pretoria, we offer transparent pricing and comprehensive **local electrician cost consultation** services. Our team serves the entire region with professional electrical solutions tailored to your budget.

Contact us today for your personalised **fair price for electrical installation** or repair.

markdown:
[Skip to content](https://www.thehandymanjohannesburg.co.za/electrical-installation-pricing/#content "Skip to content")

# Electrical Installation Pricing: Get the Best Electrical Compliance Certificate Cost and Hire Electrician Rate in Johannesburg, Roodepoort, Sandton, Randburg, Eastrand, Midrand, Centurion & Pretoria

## Electrical Installation Pricing: Compare Electrical Compliance Certificate Cost and Hire Electrician Cost in Your Area in Johannesburg, Roodepoort, Sandton, Randburg, Eastrand, Midrand, Centurion & Pretoria

**Electrical Installation Pricing** can vary by up to 50% across South Africa. Understanding current market rates is vital for proper budgeting of home renovations or repairs.

![Electrical Installation Pricing](<Base64-Image-Removed>)

Handyman Johannesburg offers a comprehensive _pricing guide_ for electrical services. Standard hourly rates range from R300 to R600. Emergency call-out fees typically cost between R500 and R700.

[Rewiring a typical 3-bedroom house costs](https://www.thehandymanjohannesburg.co.za/house-rewiring-price/) between R20,000 and R30,000. An **Electrical Certificate of Compliance** (CoC) ranges from R700 to R1500. These prices reflect current market conditions in Johannesburg, Pretoria, and Gauteng.

Our team has analysed thousands of projects to create this 2026 _cost estimator_. This guide provides transparent information based on real-world experience. It helps you understand what factors influence your final bill – [Contact Us](https://www.thehandymanjohannesburg.co.za/contact-us/)

## Electrical Installation Pricing: What to Expect in 2026

**Electrical installation pricing** in 2026 is vital for planning projects across South Africa. Material costs and labour demands change, affecting budgets for electrical work. [Handyman Johannesburg](https://www.thehandymanjohannesburg.co.za/) offers clear pricing to help clients make smart choices.

![A panoramic view of an electrical installation showroom in Johannesburg, South Africa in the year 2025. The spacious showroom features sleek, modern display units showcasing a wide range of electrical components, wiring systems, and smart home automation devices. Warm, ambient lighting casts a soft glow, highlighting the high-quality finishes and attention to detail. In the foreground, a display table showcases the latest electrical installation pricing packages, providing clear and transparent information for customers. The middle ground features sales representatives assisting clients, while the background reveals the bustling city skyline through large windows, hinting at the dynamic urban landscape.](<Base64-Image-Removed>)

### Current Market Rates for Electrical Services in South Africa

In 2026, **standard electrician rates** range from R300 to R600 per hour in South Africa. These rates reflect the skill and safety knowledge needed for quality work. Prices may vary based on experience and job complexity.

- [Electrical Handyman Services Prices 2026](https://www.thehandymanjohannesburg.co.za/electrical-handyman-services-prices/)
- [Residential Electrician Prices](https://www.thehandymanjohannesburg.co.za/residential-electrician-prices/)
- [Emergency Home Electrical Repair Pricing](https://www.thehandymanjohannesburg.co.za/emergency-home-electrical-repair-pricing/)
- [Generator Installation Costs](https://www.thehandymanjohannesburg.co.za/generator-installation-cost/)
- [Electric Car Charger Installation Costs](https://www.thehandymanjohannesburg.co.za/electric-car-charger-installation-cost/)

**Emergency call-out fees** typically cost between R500 and R700. These fees cover quick response times and after-hours availability of qualified electricians. They’re standard in the industry for urgent electrical issues.

Complete home wiring for a 3-bedroom house costs about R20,000 to R30,000. This price includes labour, materials, and compliance documents. The final cost depends on specifications and material quality.

| Service Type | Price Range (2026) | Factors Affecting Cost |
| --- | --- | --- |
| Standard Hourly Rate | R300-R600 | Electrician experience, job complexity |
| Emergency Call-Out | R500-R700 | Time of day, urgency, location |
| 3-Bedroom House Wiring | R20,000-R30,000 | House size, material quality, specifications |
| Electrical Certificate of Compliance | R850-R1,200 | Property size, system complexity |

### Regional Price Variations Across Johannesburg and Pretoria

**Electrical installation pricing** differs between Johannesburg and Pretoria. These differences reflect the varied economic landscapes across Gauteng province. They also impact your final project costs.

Affluent areas like Sandton and Waterkloof tend to have higher rates. This pricing reflects higher business costs and premium service expectations. In contrast, areas like Soweto may have slightly lower average rates.

The **electrical installation prices Gauteng** region shows clear variations. There’s a 10-15% difference between the highest and lowest-priced areas. Several factors influence these regional differences:

- Local property values and cost of living
- Accessibility and travel distances for electricians
- Competition density among electrical service providers
- Average project scope and complexity in different neighbourhoods

Handyman Johannesburg offers fair pricing throughout Gauteng without compromising quality or safety. Our clear approach ensures clients understand what they’re paying for, regardless of location.

The **latest electrical installation prices** reflect rising material costs due to supply chain issues. Copper wiring and circuit breakers have seen 5-8% price hikes since late 2026. These trends affect overall project costs in 2026.

Remember, the lowest [**electrician call out fee**](https://www.thehandymanjohannesburg.co.za/electrician-call-out-fee/) isn’t always the best value. Quality work, proper certification, and warranty coverage justify premium pricing for electrical services.

## Electrical Installation Pricing: Comprehensive Breakdown of Electrical Service Costs

**Electrical installation pricing** involves various cost components. At Handyman Johannesburg, we prioritise transparency in our service pricing. This breakdown will help you budget for your electrical projects effectively.

### Residential Electrical Installation Pricing

[Home electrical installations vary in complexity and cost](https://www.thehandymanjohannesburg.co.za/home-electrical-installation-pricing/). Understanding the pricing structure is crucial for budgeting. This applies to new builds, renovations, and system upgrades.

![Residential electrical installation pricing, a detailed breakdown showcasing service costs. In the foreground, a labeled diagram of common electrical components - outlets, switches, lighting fixtures. In the middle ground, a neatly organized table displaying per-unit pricing for installation, labor, and materials. The background features a realistic, well-lit interior of a modern home, highlighting the impact of professional electrical work. The lighting is warm and inviting, capturing the importance of safe, reliable power infrastructure. Captured with a wide-angle lens to provide comprehensive context, this image conveys the comprehensive nature of electrical service pricing for residential properties.](<Base64-Image-Removed>)

Essential components form the backbone of your home’s electrical infrastructure. These basic services are priced based on complexity and materials used.

- **Plug Points:** Single points range from R300-R500, while double points cost between R400-R600
- [**Light Fixtures:** Basic installation starts](https://www.thehandymanjohannesburg.co.za/ceiling-light-installation-cost/) at R250 per fixture, with prices increasing for complex fittings
- **Basic Wiring:** Typically charged at R80-R120 per metre, depending on cable quality and installation difficulty
- **[Distribution Board Installation price](https://www.thehandymanjohannesburg.co.za/db-board-upgrade-price/):** Ranges from R1,500-R3,000 based on size and complexity

These services meet the minimum requirements for a safe, functional electrical system. Our technicians ensure all basic installations meet high safety standards while remaining cost-effective.

#### Advanced Home Electrical Installations

Advanced installations offer additional functionality and convenience. These options enhance electrical systems with modern technology or specialised solutions.

- **Complete Home Wiring:** A typical 3-bedroom house costs between R20,000-R30,000
- **Smart Home Systems:** Starting from R5,000 for basic setups, with comprehensive systems ranging from R15,000-R50,000
- **[Security Lighting installation price](https://www.thehandymanjohannesburg.co.za/security-lighting-installation-price/):** Motion-sensor and automated systems range from R2,500-R7,000
- **Specialised Circuits:** High-power appliance circuits cost R800-R1,200 per installation

Advanced installations require greater expertise and often use premium materials. Our skilled electricians specialise in these complex installations, ensuring your home benefits from the latest innovations.

### Commercial and Industrial Electrical Pricing in Gauteng

Business and industrial premises have unique electrical requirements. These differ significantly from residential properties. The scale, complexity, and power demands necessitate specialised approaches and equipment.

| Property Type | Basic Rate (per m²) | Mid-Range (per m²) | Premium (per m²) |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |

### Compliance Certificates and Safety Standards Costs

Electrical Certificates of Compliance (CoCs) are essential for professional electrical work in South Africa. They confirm that your installation meets SANS 10142-1 safety standards.

[CoC costs](https://www.thehandymanjohannesburg.co.za/electrical-compliance-certificate-cost/) range from R700 for smaller properties to R1,500 for larger or complex systems. These certificates are legally required when:

- Selling a property
- After completing significant electrical alterations
- When adding new circuits to an existing system
- For insurance compliance purposes

The certification process involves thorough testing of your electrical installation. This includes checking earth leakage protection, circuit integrity, and overall system safety.

Be cautious of quotes with much lower prices that might skip proper certification. We always include CoC costs in our quotes for full legal compliance.

### Property Size and Installation Complexity

Your property’s size and layout directly affect your **electrical installation cost breakdown**. Larger properties need more materials, longer cables, and more labour hours, increasing the overall cost.

Installation complexity factors that influence pricing include:

- **Access difficulties**: Working in tight spaces or high ceilings requires more time and special equipment
- **Existing infrastructure**: Upgrading old electrical systems often involves extra diagnostic work and adaptation
- **Special requirements**: Custom **lighting installation pricing** increases with designer fixtures or smart controls
- **Circuit density**: Properties needing many circuits for high-power appliances involve more complex distribution systems

We do thorough site assessments before finalising your quote. This ensures we account for all complexity factors, providing accurate pricing without surprises later.

A standard three-bedroom home might need 15-20 circuits. A similar-sized property with a home office and high-end kitchen could need 25-30 circuits, affecting the **electrical panel installation pricing**.

Understanding these factors provides clarity when reviewing your **electrical installation quote**. We’re committed to clear pricing that accounts for all variables, ensuring fair value.

## FAQ

### 1\. What are the average hourly rates for electricians in South Africa for 2026?

In 2026, electrician hourly rates in South Africa range from R300-R600. Rates depend on experience, qualifications, and job complexity. At Handyman Johannesburg, we offer competitive prices with top-notch workmanship.

### 2\. How much should I expect to pay for an emergency electrical call-out?

Emergency electrical services in 2026 include a call-out fee of R500-R700. This is separate from hourly labour charges. After-hours services cost 1.5-2 times the standard rate. We maintain quality and safety despite urgency.

### 3\. What is the cost of installing new plug points in a residential property?

In 2026, new plug point installation costs R300-R500 for single points. Double points range from R400-R600. These prices cover labour and standard materials. Costs may vary based on wall type and wiring needs.

### 4\. How much does a complete house rewiring cost in Johannesburg?

Complete house rewiring in Johannesburg for 2026 costs R20,000-R30,000 for a standard 3-bedroom house. Prices vary based on property size, age, and wiring accessibility. We provide detailed quotes after thorough on-site assessments.

### 5\. What is the cost of an Electrical Certificate of Compliance (CoC)?

In 2026, an Electrical Certificate of Compliance (CoC) costs R700-R1500. The price depends on property size and system complexity. This certificate is legally required when selling property or after major electrical changes.

### 6\. Are there price differences for electrical work between different areas of Gauteng?

Yes, electrical work prices vary across Gauteng. Affluent areas like Sandton have higher rates. Areas like Soweto may have lower average rates. Handyman Johannesburg maintains fair pricing throughout the region while ensuring consistent quality.

### 7\. How much does commercial electrical installation cost per square metre?

In 2026, commercial electrical installations cost R15,000-R20,000 per square metre for offices. Retail spaces range from R12,000-R18,000 per square metre. These costs include wiring, lighting, and basic networking infrastructure.

### 8\. What factors most significantly affect the cost of electrical installation?

Key cost factors include property size, installation complexity, and material quality. Labour requirements, accessibility issues, and compliance needs also impact prices. Older properties often require more extensive work.

### 9\. Do you offer free quotes for electrical installation work?

Yes, Handyman Johannesburg provides free, no-obligation quotes for all electrical projects. Our experienced electricians assess your needs and provide detailed written quotes.

### 10\. How much does it cost to install a distribution board?

In 2026, new distribution board installation costs R3,500-R7,000. Upgrading an existing board ranges from R2,500-R5,000. Prices include the board, circuit breakers, labour, and certification.

### 11\. What is the cost of installing an EV charging point at home?

In 2026, residential EV charging point installation costs R8,000-R15,000. Price depends on charger type and your property’s electrical capacity. This includes a dedicated circuit, safety devices, and the charging unit itself.

### 12\. How much should I budget for electrical installation in a new build home?

Budget 5-7% of total construction cost for electrical installation in 2026. For a typical 3-bedroom house, this is about R60,000-R120,000.
